meanings.definition: To give special importance or prominence to something.
meanings.sent1: She emphasized the need for teamwork in the project.
meanings.sent2: The teacher emphasized the importance of studying for the exam.
meanings.sent3: The comedian emphasized the absurdity of wearing a swimsuit in the snow.
meanings.sent4: His bright red tie emphasized his otherwise plain outfit.
meanings.sent5: The flashing neon sign emphasized the entrance to the club.

meanings.sent1: He emphasized the key points during his presentation.
meanings.sent2: The bold font emphasized the title of the book.
meanings.sent3: The cat emphasized its hunger by meowing loudly.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds emphasized the approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The loud music emphasized the excitement of the party.

meanings.definition: To make something stand out or be more noticeable.
meanings.sent1: The artist emphasized the contrast between light and dark in the painting.
meanings.sent2: Using a highlighter, she emphasized the important dates in her planner.
meanings.sent3: The chef emphasized the flavor of the dish with a sprinkle of fresh herbs.
meanings.sent4: The bright red door emphasized the entrance to the house.
meanings.sent5: The spotlight emphasized the lead singer on stage.
